DOC.brief_summary: Stenting is an alternative to traditional surgery in the treatment of carotid stenosis.The intra and/or postprocedural cerebral embolization remains the most frequent complication. Thanks to the systematic use of cerebral protection systems, these complications have reduced.A debate concerning which cerebral protective device should be more effective is still ongoing.
DOC.brief_title: Carotid Stenting in Patients With High Risk Carotid Stenosis ("Soft Plaque")
DOC.criteria: patients with monolateral, significant, soft carotid stenosis patients with controlateral carotid occlusion patients with critic stenosis of the external carotid
